paper_abstract: Let p(c)(Q(n)) and p(c)(Z(n)) denote the critical values for nearest-neighbour bond percolation on the n-cube Q(n) = {0, 1}(n) and on Z(n), respectively. Let Omega = n for G = Q(n) and Omega = 2n for G = Z(n) denote the degree of G. We use the lace expansion to prove that for both G = Q(n) and G = Z(n), p(c)(G) = Omega(-1) + Omega(-2) + 2/7 Omega(-3) + O(Omega(-4)). This extends by two terms the result p(c)(Q(n)) = Omega(-1) + O(Omega(-2)) of Borgs, Chayes, van der Hofstad, Slade and Spencer, and provides a simplified proof of a previous result of Hara and Slade for Z(n).
paper_title: Expansion in n(-1) for percolation critical values on the n-cube and Z(n): the first three terms
